result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan A Smith

defendant.name: Smith, Megan A
defendant.address: N2639 County Rd ZE89, Dousman, WI 53118

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Court will allow possession of alcoholic beverage for use of employment, however no consumption.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witnesses A-E/business (EXCEPTION for contact for victim A: though any family case orders out of Milwaukee County case 22FA3089 or through Our Family Wizard ONLY for the sole purpose of the custody and placement of the minor child(ren))listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

8:23 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Megan A Smith in court.  Attorney Alexis Garuz in court for Megan A Smith. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Atty Garuz appears on behalf of the Defendant
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 10/21/2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
